page.title: 07MUNDON - LIFE ON THE FARMS
page.content: Although the people living on Fresh- fields and Iltney farms are a little remote they do not find this a real problem. It is,of course,necessary to have at least two cars so that the wife can go shopping and ferry the children around while the husband attends to his business.But this also applies to anyone living in one of the outlying villages because public transport is so poor. To avoid the need to shop every day freezers are used. Farmers are more self-sufficient than many people since they can grow their own vegetables. There are some minor problems. There is no refuse collection;no gas and no newspapers delivered - but noone was complaining. by Megan Jones 1B2
